models.name: discuss_board_settings
models.description: Global system configuration for the discussBoard platform. Holds platform-wide settings such as max post/comment length, maintenance mode flag, notification policies, data retention periods, or any feature flag toggles. Managed exclusively by administrators, sets the foundation for all application logic and enforcement. Only one row should exist at any time.

plainFields.name: config_json
plainFields.description: JSON string of system-wide configurable options such as ratios, toggle flags, policy versions, and detailed policy parameters.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of when this settings record was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last update to settings record.

models.name: discuss_board_forbidden_words
models.description: Catalog of keywords, phrases, or regexes forbidden from user content due to policy violations (e.g., hate speech, profanity, spam). Used for filtering post and comment content at creation or update. Managed by administrators and updated as guideline policies evolve. Each word or expression is unique and case-insensitive.

plainFields.name: expression
plainFields.description: Forbidden word, phrase, or regex pattern (case-insensitive).

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Administrative description, business rationale, or policy context for this forbidden word or pattern.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Time this forbidden word or pattern was registered.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update time for this record.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete flag: time this entry was removed by administrators, if applicable.

models.name: discuss_board_privacy_logs
models.description: Audit records for all privacy-sensitive actions taken on user data. Entries document accesses, exports, deletions, and policy updates impacting user information, with who did it, which data subject, operation type, outcome, and timestamp. Provides a robust audit trail for privacy compliance and incident response. References user/account ids in other tables for traceability, but never stores confidential data directly.

foreignFields.name: actor_user_account_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the user account that performed the privacy-related action. {@link discuss_board_user_accounts.id}.

foreignFields.name: data_subject_user_account_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the data subject impacted by the action (could be same as actor, or another user). {@link discuss_board_user_accounts.id}.

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Type of privacy operation (access, export, delete, policy update, consent change, etc.).

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Business context or justification for the privacy operation, including outcome or relevant audit notes.

plainFields.name: result_status
plainFields.description: Result of the privacy action (success, failure, partial). For audit reporting.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this action was performed (UTC).

models.name: discuss_board_consent_records
models.description: Stores individual user consent events for privacy, terms of service, or other legal agreements. Contains who provided consent, policy/document version, consent action (granted, revoked, updated), and timestamp. Required for legal defensibility and to fulfill user data rights requests. Each event is preserved historically—this table acts as an append-only log.

foreignFields.name: user_account_id
foreignFields.description: User account giving or updating consent. {@link discuss_board_user_accounts.id}.

plainFields.name: policy_type
plainFields.description: Type of policy for which consent is being tracked (e.g. 'privacy_policy', 'terms_of_service', 'marketing_opt_in').

plainFields.name: policy_version
plainFields.description: Version or identifier of the policy/legal document the user is consenting to.

plainFields.name: consent_action
plainFields.description: What the event represents: (e.g. 'granted', 'revoked', 'updated').

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Optional business notes regarding the consent record, such as rationale or evidence (IP address, device, etc.).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this consent record/event was created (UTC).

models.name: discuss_board_guests
models.description: Represents unauthenticated or temporary visitors tracked for analytics, onboarding funnels, and guest-to-member conversion. Does not include any privileged actions. Linked to analytics pipelines and business event logs. Not tied to posts or comments directly.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address of the guest user for analytics and security monitoring.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: User agent string representing the guest's browser/device for analytics.

plainFields.name: referer
plainFields.description: Origin URL where the guest came from for conversion analysis.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when guest was first observed.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last analytics-update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp if guest data is anonymized for privacy removal.

models.name: discuss_board_members
models.description: Registered member accounts representing authenticated users with ability to participate. Each member can have escalation to moderator/administrator or downgrade. Linked to discuss_board_user_accounts for authentication and can be tied to discuss_board_user_profiles.

foreignFields.name: user_account_id
foreignFields.description: User account for authentication. {@link discuss_board_user_accounts.id}

plainFields.name: nickname
plainFields.description: Member's public display nickname.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current status (active, suspended, banned, etc.).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Signup timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last member profile update timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for soft deletion or account anonymization.

models.name: discuss_board_moderators
models.description: Moderator role accounts, each linked to exactly one member. Grants enforcement, review, and moderation privileges. Tracks authority escalation. Has independent status and audit window for assignment/revocation.

foreignFields.name: member_id
foreignFields.description: Target member account granted moderator rights. {@link discuss_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: assigned_by_administrator_id
plainFields.description: Administrator who granted moderator role. {@link discuss_board_administrators.id}

plainFields.name: assigned_at
plainFields.description: Moderator assignment timestamp.

plainFields.name: revoked_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when moderator role was revoked, if applicable.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Moderator role status (active, suspended, revoked).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp for audit.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Update timestamp for auditing changes.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for soft deletion/removal from moderator pool.

models.name: discuss_board_administrators
models.description: Administrator/superuser role accounts, linked to members. Possesses comprehensive management, escalation, and audit powers. May assign or revoke other roles (including moderators) and configure global system settings.

foreignFields.name: member_id
foreignFields.description: Target member promoted to administrator. {@link discuss_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: escalated_by_administrator_id
plainFields.description: Administrator who performed the escalation. {@link discuss_board_administrators.id}

plainFields.name: escalated_at
plainFields.description: Promotion/assignment timestamp.

plainFields.name: revoked_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp if removed from admin role/privileges revoked.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Administrator status (active, resigned, suspended).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of admin role creation for auditing.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last admin role update/audit.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp to support soft delete/audit disablement.

models.name: discuss_board_user_accounts
models.description: Core authentication/identity records for platform users. Decouples authentication from role, supporting locked-out or staged accounts, and multi-role escalation. Used as authoritative linkage for login, JWT sessions.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Unique email address identifying the platform user.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: BCrypt/argon hashed password (never plain text).

plainFields.name: email_verified
plainFields.description: Whether user completed email verification process required for elevated privileges.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Account status (pending, active, locked, disabled, etc.).

plainFields.name: last_login_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent login/session creation.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Initial account creation timestamp.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for credential update (e.g., password change).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Anonymization/removal date for deleted accounts.

models.name: discuss_board_jwt_sessions
models.description: Tracks active JWT tokens and sessions for user authentication. Used for session revocation, device management, and refresh flows. Relates to discuss_board_user_accounts as FK.

foreignFields.name: user_account_id
foreignFields.description: Foreign key to user account that owns this session. {@link discuss_board_user_accounts.id}

plainFields.name: jwt_id
plainFields.description: JWT unique identifier (jti claim).

plainFields.name: refresh_token_hash
plainFields.description: Hashed refresh token for this session, for secure revocation.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Logged-in device/browser info for management.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: Origin IP address used at login time.

plainFields.name: issued_at
plainFields.description: JWT/session creation/issuance time.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: JWT/session absolute expiration time.

plainFields.name: revoked_at
plainFields.description: Time the session was forcibly revoked before expiry.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Session object creation time.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Session object last update (device status, etc.).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Date/time if session data was hard-deleted for cleanup or privacy.

models.name: discuss_board_user_profiles
models.description: Profile metadata table for user display, including avatar, bio, and optional personalization fields. Tied to a member, managed through profile-edit UIs, never independently instantiated from business perspective.

foreignFields.name: member_id
foreignFields.description: Foreign key to the registered member this profile belongs to. {@link discuss_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: display_name
plainFields.description: User's chosen display name for presentation (may override registered nickname).

plainFields.name: bio
plainFields.description: Short biography or introduction written by the user (may include links, hashtags, etc.).

plainFields.name: avatar_uri
plainFields.description: URI to user-chosen avatar/profile image.

plainFields.name: location
plainFields.description: Optional location or timezone string for the user.

plainFields.name: website
plainFields.description: Link to user's personal website (optional).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: When profile object was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp from user or admin.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for profile removal/anonymization.

models.name: discuss_board_user_notification_preferences
models.description: Stores per-user notification delivery and channel preferences, such as email/SMS/push, per event-type, etc. Used to manage communication flows and compliance. Each record points to a member, must be editable via account UI.

foreignFields.name: member_id
foreignFields.description: Member account whose notification preferences are configured. {@link discuss_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: email_notifications_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether user receives system email notifications.

plainFields.name: sms_notifications_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether user receives SMS notifications for critical flows.

plainFields.name: push_notifications_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether user receives push notifications in mobile/web apps.

plainFields.name: newsletter_opt_in
plainFields.description: Whether user agrees to receive newsletters and announcements.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when preferences were created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when preferences were last updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp for user opt-out or data privacy action.

models.name: discuss_board_posts
models.description: Central table for user-created posts/topics. Each post belongs to a member (author), contains a title, body, and can be assigned tags via discuss_board_post_tags. Enforcement of edit and delete windows is managed at the application level but tracked for auditing via related snapshot tables. Post privacy/visibility controls are stored as business_status. References member as author via user/member table. Used as the target for comments, reactions, deletion logs, and moderation actions. Strictly normalized for data integrity.

foreignFields.name: author_id
foreignFields.description: Author's unique identifier, references {@link discuss_board_members.id}.

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description: Title of the post, required for identification and search, 5-150 chars enforced at application layer.

plainFields.name: body
plainFields.description: Main text content of the post, required, 10-10,000 chars enforced at application layer.

plainFields.name: business_status
plainFields.description: Post visibility or workflow status (e.g., public, limited, private, locked, under_review). Used by access and moderation logic.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp (UTC).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp (UTC).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp, null if not deleted.

models.name: discuss_board_post_tags
models.description: Assigns tags to posts, representing a junction table for the M:N relationship between posts and tags (if tags are entity/table-based). Enforces unique tag per post constraint. Enables topic categorization, search, and filtering by tag. Referenced in post search/filter endpoints and analytics.

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: Linked post's {@link discuss_board_posts.id}.

plainFields.name: tag_id
plainFields.description: Tag identifier (UUID). A valid tag UUID as defined in the source tag table or system. Relation is not enforced at schema level; see documentation for tag source resolution.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Assignment timestamp.

models.name: discuss_board_post_edit_histories
models.description: History and audit trail of post edits for compliance and moderation review. Captures each point-in-time version of a post, including all changed content, author, and timestamps. Enables rollback, user view of edit log, and accountability for all changes. Model is append-only and never directly modified post-creation.

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: Original post's {@link discuss_board_posts.id}.

foreignFields.name: editor_id
foreignFields.description: User/member who made the edit, references {@link discuss_board_members.id}.

plainFields.name: edited_title
plainFields.description: Edited title snapshot.

plainFields.name: edited_body
plainFields.description: Edited body/content snapshot.

plainFields.name: edit_reason
plainFields.description: Optional reason/annotation for edit (e.g., typo fix, clarification update).

plainFields.name: edit_timestamp
plainFields.description: When the edit occurred (UTC).

models.name: discuss_board_post_deletion_logs
models.description: Audit log capturing all deletion events for posts (soft or hard). Records who deleted the post, when, and the reason. Enables regulatory compliance, investigation, and dispute resolution. Never deleted/updated after creation; read-only audit record.

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: Deleted post's {@link discuss_board_posts.id}.

foreignFields.name: actor_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator/member/administrator who performed deletion, references existing discuss_board_members or higher privilege role.

plainFields.name: deletion_timestamp
plainFields.description: When the deletion occurred (UTC).

plainFields.name: deletion_reason
plainFields.description: Business or regulatory reason for deletion, e.g., user request, moderation action, policy violation. For compliance/audit.

models.name: discuss_board_comments
models.description: Stores all comments in the discussion board, supporting nested replies via parent-child relationships. Each comment references the original post, its parent comment if a reply, and the authoring member. Business fields include content, status, edit and delete timestamps, and a lock flag for moderation or business rule enforcement. Full-text GIN index supports search. Core to discussion and moderation.

foreignFields.name: discuss_board_post_id
foreignFields.description: Belonged post's {@link discuss_board_posts.id}

foreignFields.name: parent_id
foreignFields.description: Parent comment's {@link discuss_board_comments.id}, nullable for top-level comments.

foreignFields.name: author_member_id
foreignFields.description: Authoring member's {@link discuss_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: Content body of the comment. Min 2, max 2000 chars. Subject to moderation and full-text search.

plainFields.name: depth
plainFields.description: Indicates depth of the comment (number of ancestor chain from post root), used for nesting enforcement. Business logic checks value up to max thread depth.

plainFields.name: is_locked
plainFields.description: Flag whether the comment is locked and cannot be edited/deleted, typically due to expired edit window or moderation action.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Business status of the comment (e.g., 'active', 'under_review', 'deleted'). Used for workflow enforcement and UI display.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: UTC timestamp of comment creation.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: UTC timestamp of last update/modification.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft-delete timestamp; null if active, else marks deletion for audit and regulatory purposes.

models.name: discuss_board_comment_edit_histories
models.description: Tracks all edits for comments. Each record links to its parent comment, the editing member, and stores the edit snapshot including previous content, status, and a UTC timestamp. Used for audit history, moderation, and rollback. Append-only. Never directly user-managed; subsidiary to comment.

foreignFields.name: discuss_board_comment_id
foreignFields.description: Target comment's {@link discuss_board_comments.id}

foreignFields.name: editor_member_id
foreignFields.description: Editing member's {@link discuss_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: previous_content
plainFields.description: Content of the comment prior to the edit. For audit/history/reversion. Max 2000 chars.

plainFields.name: previous_status
plainFields.description: Value of business status field prior to edit (e.g., 'active', 'under_review', 'deleted').

plainFields.name: editor_note
plainFields.description: Optional note from editor indicating reason for edit, user-visible in audit/history. Max 200 chars.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: UTC timestamp of this edit event (when snapshot was recorded).

models.name: discuss_board_comment_deletion_logs
models.description: Stores every deletion event for comments, including soft-deletes and hard deletes. References comment, the deleting actor (who may be author, moderator, or admin), records deletion reason for compliance and appeals, and UTC deletion timestamp. Never managed directly by users; subsidiary log for transparency and audit.

foreignFields.name: discuss_board_comment_id
foreignFields.description: Target comment's {@link discuss_board_comments.id}

foreignFields.name: actor_user_account_id
foreignFields.description: Deleting actor's user account {@link discuss_board_user_accounts.id} (can be author, moderator, or admin) to support all escalation cases.

plainFields.name: deletion_reason
plainFields.description: Enumerates reason for deletion (e.g., 'self_delete', 'moderation_violation', 'admin_enforcement'). Required for audit.

plainFields.name: actor_note
plainFields.description: Optional note by deleting actor for audit or appeals.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: UTC timestamp of when deletion occurred. May differ from content's deleted_at for delayed cases.

models.name: discuss_board_post_reactions
models.description: Represents each individual reaction (like/dislike) made by a member on a specific post. Ensures exactly one reaction per member-post pair, allows toggling between reaction types, and supports complete audit trail. Related directly to {@link discuss_board_members.id} and {@link discuss_board_posts.id}. Supports soft-deletion for compliance and auditability.

foreignFields.name: discuss_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Reactor member's {@link discuss_board_members.id}. Indicates which member performed the reaction.

foreignFields.name: discuss_board_post_id
foreignFields.description: Target post's {@link discuss_board_posts.id} which receives the reaction.

plainFields.name: reaction_type
plainFields.description: Type of reaction. Either 'like' or 'dislike'. Business logic restricts to these values.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the reaction was first created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for the most recent update to the reaction (toggle or metadata change).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp; nullable. Set when reaction is logically removed and no longer counted for aggregates.

models.name: discuss_board_comment_reactions
models.description: Captures each member's explicit like/dislike reaction to a particular comment. Enforces single reaction per member-comment pair and audit-aware toggling of reaction. References {@link discuss_board_members.id} and {@link discuss_board_comments.id}. Includes soft-delete pattern for reversibility and compliance.

foreignFields.name: discuss_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member's {@link discuss_board_members.id} who reacted to the comment.

foreignFields.name: discuss_board_comment_id
foreignFields.description: Target comment's {@link discuss_board_comments.id}.

plainFields.name: reaction_type
plainFields.description: Type of reaction: 'like' or 'dislike'. Only one value per comment/member. Business logic enforces valid values.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of reaction creation.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last modification (for toggling or recovery).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete; nullable. Populated when reaction is not counted in aggregates, supports logical undeletion for audit.

models.name: discuss_board_content_reports
models.description: Records reports of posts or comments for moderation review. Each record tracks the reporting user, reported content (post or comment), type of content, report reason, status, and workflow timestamps. Used by moderators and administrators to triage, review, and resolve complaints submitted by members. References actors in user-related tables, and content in posts/comments. Enables searching all reports, viewing by content, user, or resolution status. Essential for strict audit trails and abuse prevention. Supports one-to-many relationships with moderation actions (an action may resolve multiple reports).

foreignFields.name: reporter_member_id
foreignFields.description: Reporting user's {@link discuss_board_members.id}. References the member who submitted the report.

foreignFields.name: content_post_id
foreignFields.description: Reported post's {@link discuss_board_posts.id}. Exactly one of content_post_id or content_comment_id must be non-null. References the reported post, if this report is for a post.

foreignFields.name: content_comment_id
foreignFields.description: Reported comment's {@link discuss_board_comments.id}. Exactly one of content_post_id or content_comment_id must be non-null. References the reported comment, if this report is for a comment.

plainFields.name: content_type
plainFields.description: Type of content being reported (e.g., 'post', 'comment'). Required to determine which foreign key applies. Ensures correct content reference and workflow routing.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Reporter-supplied reason for the report. Collected from predefined list (spam, harassment, abuse, misinformation) or freeform up to 200 characters. Used for workflow triage and full-text search by moderators.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current workflow status (pending, under_review, resolved, dismissed, escalated). Used for moderation queue, progress, and reporting.

plainFields.name: moderation_action_id
plainFields.description: ID of the associated moderation action (if resolved). Used for historical workflow, linking to decisions/actions. Nullable—assigned only when resolution occurs.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: UTC creation timestamp for the report, required for audit and chronological workflow.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: UTC last updated timestamp.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: UTC deleted timestamp, set if report is soft deleted (for compliance).

models.name: discuss_board_moderation_actions
models.description: Tracks actionable moderation decisions (e.g., content removal, warning, user suspension) initiated as the resolution of reports or other triggers. Includes responsible moderator/admin, target content/user, type of action, reason, decision narrative, and linkage to appeal if present. Supports compliance by enabling queries by action type, actor, or content. All moderation history for audit trails is anchored here. May reference multiple reports via moderation_action_id in reports.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator/admin executing the action. {@link discuss_board_moderators.id} or {@link discuss_board_administrators.id}.

foreignFields.name: target_member_id
foreignFields.description: Target user of action (usually the content author). {@link discuss_board_members.id}. Nullable for actions on content only (not directly on a user).

foreignFields.name: target_post_id
foreignFields.description: Target post id if action taken on post. {@link discuss_board_posts.id}.

foreignFields.name: target_comment_id
foreignFields.description: Target comment id if action taken on comment. {@link discuss_board_comments.id}.

plainFields.name: appeal_id
plainFields.description: ID of the associated appeal if present. Nullable; for business linkage only, not enforced as a FK due to circular dependency concerns. See {@link discuss_board_appeals.id}.

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Type of moderation action (remove_content, warn, suspend_user, ban_user, escalate, etc). Enables filtering and business logic enforcement for audit and policy.

plainFields.name: action_reason
plainFields.description: Moderator/admin's chosen reason or rationale for action, displayed to target user and for legal/audit review.

plainFields.name: decision_narrative
plainFields.description: Freeform optional narrative describing moderator context/analysis for final decision. Aids transparency, supports appeals/audits.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current status (active, reversed, escalated, completed, pending_applied). Used for tracking and workflow management. Historical records remain for all actions.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: UTC timestamp for when action was created. Used for audit/order of operations.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: UTC timestamp of last update.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp for removal from active search (audit/compliance only).

models.name: discuss_board_appeals
models.description: Captures appeals submitted by users regarding moderation actions. Used to manage re-reviews and escalation workflows, ensuring fair process and business/legal compliance. Records which action is appealed, appellant user, status, rationale, and administrative resolution log. Allows independent search and workflow management, as appeals can traverse multiple moderation actions or administrators. Supports tracking appeal lifecycle (pending, in_review, accepted, denied, escalated, closed). Enables transparency and user trust.

foreignFields.name: moderation_action_id
foreignFields.description: The moderation action being appealed. {@link discuss_board_moderation_actions.id}. Required for linking review chains, audit.

foreignFields.name: appellant_member_id
foreignFields.description: The member submitting the appeal. {@link discuss_board_members.id}.

plainFields.name: appeal_rationale
plainFields.description: Freeform rationale or argument provided by the appellant, explaining why the moderation action should be reconsidered. Used by administrators for re-review.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current workflow status (pending, in_review, accepted, denied, escalated, closed). Used in queueing, reporting, and managing the appeals process.

plainFields.name: resolution_notes
plainFields.description: Resolution notes entered by the administrator or appellate moderator upon closing the appeal. Documents outcome for further audit or user transparency.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: UTC timestamp when appeal was submitted.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: UTC timestamp of last update to the appeal record.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deleted timestamp, if the appeal is removed from active search (for audit/compliance only).

models.name: discuss_board_moderation_logs
models.description: Supports fine-grained logging of every important moderation event, action, escalation step, or workflow update. Enables detailed audit trail for compliance, transparency, and business process improvement. Logs may reference specific moderation action, appeal, or content, and capture actor, event type, details, timestamp. Used exclusively for system/logical review—not directly managed by end users. Enables strict normalization and referential integrity. Useful for administrators and compliance investigators.

foreignFields.name: actor_member_id
foreignFields.description: The user (member, moderator, or administrator) responsible for the logged event. Foreign key to either discuss_board_members, discuss_board_moderators, or discuss_board_administrators depending on context.

foreignFields.name: related_action_id
foreignFields.description: Associated moderation action. Enables workflow/event traceability. {@link discuss_board_moderation_actions.id}.

foreignFields.name: related_appeal_id
foreignFields.description: Associated appeal. Links log entry to appeal process where appropriate. {@link discuss_board_appeals.id}.

foreignFields.name: related_report_id
foreignFields.description: Associated report. Enables granular linkage to the report that initiated the workflow. {@link discuss_board_content_reports.id}.

plainFields.name: event_type
plainFields.description: Type of moderation log event (report_received, action_taken, appeal_created, status_update, escalation, etc). Enables search/filter for auditing and performance review.

plainFields.name: event_details
plainFields.description: Optional freeform field for extra detail about the log event. Documenting context may support compliance/governance.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: UTC timestamp for the log event creation for accurate audit trail.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp for audit compliance. Soft deleted logs remain for reference, not shown in normal searches.

models.name: discuss_board_notifications
models.description: Stores all outbound notification events for discussBoard platform users, covering email, SMS, push, and in-app notification deliveries. Tracks delivery status, event type (e.g., reply, moderation, system alerts), targeted user, message subject/content, and external tracking for compliance (with references to user account and source event). Enables searching/filtering notifications per user, event type, or status. Essential for troubleshooting, analytics, and compliance audits in all notification delivery workflows. {@link discuss_board_user_accounts.id} is used as the recipient reference.

foreignFields.name: user_account_id
foreignFields.description: Intended notification recipient's {@link discuss_board_user_accounts.id} field. Captures which user should receive this notification.

foreignFields.name: source_post_id
foreignFields.description: Optional reference to source post/event that triggered the notification. Links to {@link discuss_board_posts.id} if applicable.

plainFields.name: event_type
plainFields.description: Type of notification event (e.g., reply, moderation, system_alert, password_reset, etc.). Drives user routing and compliance logic.

plainFields.name: delivery_channel
plainFields.description: Notification delivery channel (e.g., email, sms, push, in_app, webhook). Determines integration and delivery workflow.

plainFields.name: subject
plainFields.description: Notification subject line or brief summary. Required for most email/SMS; optional for in-app/push; enables full-text search.

plainFields.name: body
plainFields.description: Notification message content. May be templated, localized, or rendered in markdown/HTML.

plainFields.name: external_message_id
plainFields.description: ID assigned by external delivery platforms (e.g., SMTP, SMS gateway). Enables troubleshooting and compliance verification.

plainFields.name: delivery_status
plainFields.description: Current delivery status (e.g., pending, delivered, failed, bounced, suppressed). Used for retry and compliance workflows.

plainFields.name: delivery_attempts
plainFields.description: Number of delivery attempts made (for failed or retryable messages).

plainFields.name: delivered_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of successful delivery, if occurred. Enables delivery tracking/audit.

plainFields.name: error_message
plainFields.description: Detailed error message if delivery failed. Useful for compliance, troubleshooting, and alerting.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the notification was created in the system (enqueue time).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last modification to this notification record (status/process/metadata).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp if this notification is soft-deleted (hidden from normal views, retained for audit/compliance).

models.name: discuss_board_integration_logs
models.description: Logs all key integration events between the discussBoard platform and external partners (e.g., notification delivery APIs, analytics ingestion, abuse detection/anti-spam, third-party reporting, partner API exchanges). Each record captures the integration type, status, payload, user (if applicable), and delivery metadata. Used for troubleshooting, compliance, SLA monitoring, external partner audits, and system reliability analytics. {@link discuss_board_user_accounts.id} is optionally included to relate to a user context.

foreignFields.name: user_account_id
foreignFields.description: Optional user context for the integration event. May reference {@link discuss_board_user_accounts.id}, if the event is user-initiated or user-facing (e.g., user export, notification relay); nullable for system/system-to-system integrations.

plainFields.name: integration_type
plainFields.description: Type/category of integration event (e.g., notification_delivery, analytics, abuse_detection, partner_api, import_export, etc.). Drives business logic and compliance reporting.

plainFields.name: integration_partner
plainFields.description: Integration partner or external service name (e.g., SendGrid, Twilio, GoogleAnalytics, Salesforce, etc.).

plainFields.name: payload
plainFields.description: Raw payload (request/response/metadata) for audit and troubleshooting. Serialized as JSON, XML, etc.

plainFields.name: integration_status
plainFields.description: Current status of integration event (e.g., pending, success, failed, retried, quarantined). Required for monitoring/alerting.

plainFields.name: external_reference_id
plainFields.description: External integration reference ID (assigned by partner, e.g., job ID, transaction ID, message ID); enables cross-system tracing and compliance.

plainFields.name: triggered_event
plainFields.description: Associated business event (e.g., post_created, comment_reported, moderation_action, user_exported). Improves analytics/monitoring granularity.

plainFields.name: error_message
plainFields.description: Detailed error message if the integration failed or was retried. Useful for compliance and technical support.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when integration event was recorded (system UTC).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last status update/modification.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp if event is soft-deleted (retained for audit/compliance).

models.name: discuss_board_global_audit_logs
models.description: Global, cross-entity business audit log for tracking all major actions and state changes (including user activity, content edits/deletions, moderation actions, critical admin events, and consent/compliance changes). Allows compliance audits, forensic analysis, and business metric tracking. Supports both entity-specific and system-wide events, referencing the actor (user/admin/moderator) and target object (table/type/id) polymorphically. Designed for centralized history queries and external export.

plainFields.name: actor_id
plainFields.description: ID of the actor responsible for this event (may reference discuss_board_user_accounts, discuss_board_members, discuss_board_adminstrators, etc.; polymorphic usage, so FK is not enforced).

plainFields.name: actor_type
plainFields.description: Type of actor for this audit event. Examples: 'member', 'moderator', 'administrator', 'guest', or service/automation type.

plainFields.name: action_category
plainFields.description: Business-level category of the audit event. E.g., 'post_edit', 'comment_delete', 'user_login', 'role_escalation', 'moderation_action', 'consent_update', etc.

plainFields.name: target_table
plainFields.description: Target table/entity type for the affected object, e.g., 'discuss_board_posts', 'discuss_board_comments', 'discuss_board_members', etc.

plainFields.name: target_id
plainFields.description: UUID of the affected object in the target table/entity. Polymorphic—can refer to post/comment/user/settings as needed.

plainFields.name: event_payload
plainFields.description: Optional serialized event details/context (JSON or text) containing pre-/post-state, reason, IP/user-agent, or expanded change info for audit/external export. NULL for events where no further details are captured.

plainFields.name: event_description
plainFields.description: Brief human-readable description of this audit event for API search/export. Example: 'Moderator deleted a comment for violating policy.'

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Time this audit event was recorded (UTC, immutable).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete marker for this audit log record. Used for audit retention; if null, audit entry is active.
